required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Identify Participants With Urothelial Cancer and Fibroblast Growth Factor Receptor Gene Aberrations
clinical_study.official_title: Biomarker Study to Identify Subjects With Urothelial Cancer and Fibroblast Growth Factor Receptor Gene Aberrations

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this non-interventional study is to identify participants with urothelial cancer (UC) and selected fibroblast growth factor receptor (FGFR) aberrations through molecular testing of their archival tumor tissue.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Urothelial Cancer (UC)
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with UC will be assessed through molecular testing of their archival tumor tissue.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Selected Fibroblast Growth Factor Receptor (FGFR) Aberrations
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with selected FGFR aberrations will be assessed through molecular testing of their archival tumor tissue.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Participants with Urothelial Cancer,selected FGFR aberrations
arm_group.description: Participants with urothelial cancer (UC) will be evaluated for the prevalence of positive results of selected fibroblast growth factor receptor (FGFR) aberrations and will be assessed for eligibility status for erdafitinib studies. The primary data source for this study will be the medical records of each participant.

intervention.description: Percentage of participants with UC and selected FGFR aberrations will be assessed through molecular testing of their archival tumor tissue.
intervention.arm_group_label: Participants with Urothelial Cancer,selected FGFR aberrations

study_pop.textblock: Participants with urothelial cancer (UC) and selected fibroblast growth factor receptor (FGFR) aberrations.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Transitional cell carcinoma of the urothelium. Urothelial cell carcinoma (UCC) variants are allowed, that is, UCC with squamous and/or glandular differentiation, micropapillary, nested, plasmacytoid, neuroendocrine, and sarcomatoid
- Diagnosis of one of the following: a) Metastatic or surgically unresectable urothelial cancer (UC) (Stage IV) or, b) localized surgically-resectable or resected UC with a T classification of T2 or above who are at high risk for progression to advanced disease as assessed by the investigator or,c) Non-muscle-invasive urothelial carcinoma of the bladder (Ta, T1 and carcinoma in situ [CIS])
- Available archival tissue sample for fibroblast growth factor receptor (FGFR) aberration analysis
Exclusion Criteria:
-
